javadoc: LocalManagedBufferFile implements a BufferFile as block-oriented random-access file which utilizes a BufferFileManager to identify and facilitate versioning of buffer files. This type of buffer file supports both save-as and save operations. The file format used is identical to a LocalBufferFile, although additional support is provided for associated files which facilitate versioning (e.g., ChangeMapFile, VersionFile, and changed data files).

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Open the initial version of a block file for writing.

params.name: bufferSize
params.comment: user buffer size

params.name: bfManager
params.comment: buffer file version manager

params.name: checkinId
params.comment: the checkinId for creating a versioned buffer file.

throws.comment:
if an IO error occurs or the incorrect magicNumber
 was read from the file.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Open the current version of an existing block file as read-only.

params.name: bfManager
params.comment: buffer file version manager

params.name: versionUpdateEnabled
params.comment: if true Save support is enabled (pre-save starts automatically).

params.name: minChangeDataVer
params.comment:
indicates the oldest change data buffer file to be
 included.  A -1 indicates only the last change data buffer file is applicable.

params.name: checkinId
params.comment: the checkinId for versioned buffer files which are opened for update.

throws.comment:
if an IO error occurs or the incorrect magicNumber
 was read from the file.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Open an older version of an existing buffer file as read-only and NOT UPDATEABLE (bfMgr remains null).
 Version files must exist for all versions starting with the requested version.
 These version files will be used in conjunction with the current buffer file
 to emulate an older version buffer file.

params.name: bfManager
params.comment: buffer file version manager

params.name: version
params.comment: version of file to be opened

params.name: minChangeDataVer
params.comment:
indicates the oldest change data buffer file to be
 included.  A -1 indicates only the last change data buffer file is applicable.

throws.comment:
if an IO error occurs or a problem with the version
 reconstruction.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a new empty file for pre-save use.

params.name: presaveFile
params.comment: pre-save file

params.name: bufferSize
params.comment: buffer size

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs during file creation

methods.javadoc: @return version associated with this buffer file
methods.name: getVersion

return.comment: version associated with this buffer file

methods.name: versionBufferIfNeeded
methods.comment: Output old data for a specified buffer if required for version file.

params.name: index
params.comment: buffer index

methods.name: createNewVersion
methods.comment: Create a new buffer file version (used for checkin)

params.name: destFile
params.comment:
must be an versioned file representing an earlier version
 of srcFile.

methods.name: getSaveFile
methods.comment:
Returns a Save file if available.  Returns null if
 a save can not be performed.  This method may block for an extended
 period of time if the pre-save process has not already completed.
 This method does not accept a monitor since a remote TaskMonitor does
 not yet exist.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: optional monitor for canceling pre-save (may be null)

throws.comment: if monitor specified and pre-save cancelled

methods.javadoc:
Initiate a background pre-save if possible.
 This is intended to save time for the final Save.
 when only a small number of changes will be made.  If an I/O error
 or other exception occurs during the process, the preSave will
 be aborted silently.
@param filename name of preSave file.  The preSave file will
 be created within the same directory as the source file.  If this file
 already exists, this method will have no affect.
@throws IllegalStateException if this method is invoked more than
 once for a given instance or a source file was not used.  This method 
 may be re-invoked after saveAs is invoked.
methods.name: startPreSave
methods.comment:
Initiate a background pre-save if possible.
 This is intended to save time for the final Save.
 when only a small number of changes will be made.  If an I/O error
 or other exception occurs during the process, the preSave will
 be aborted silently.

methods.javadoc:
Terminate background save if it is running.
 This may be unsuccessful if this thread is interupted.
@param endUpdate if true and pre-save successfully terminated, 
 notify buffer file manager that update has ended.
methods.name: stopPreSave
methods.comment:
Terminate background save if it is running.
 This may be unsuccessful if this thread is interupted.

params.name: endUpdate
params.comment:
if true and pre-save successfully terminated, 
 notify buffer file manager that update has ended.

methods.name: waitForPreSave

params.name: monitor
params.comment:
optional monitor allowing the pre-save wait to be interrupted/canceled - the actual pre-save will 
 continue since it may be required for a future save operation.

methods.name: getOutputBlockStream
methods.comment: Obtain a direct stream to write blocks to this buffer file

params.name: blockCount
params.comment: number of blocks to be transferred

methods.name: getInputBlockStream
methods.comment: Obtain a direct stream to read all blocks of this buffer file

methods.name: getInputBlockStream
methods.comment:
Obtain a direct stream to read modified blocks of this buffer file 
 based upon the specified changeMap

methods.name: updateFrom
methods.comment:
Create a new version of this file by updating it from a versionedBufferFile.  
 This file must be open as read-only with versionUpdateEnabled and have been derived 
 from an oldVersion of the versionedBufferFile (i.e., was based on a check-out of oldVersion).
 The save-file corresponding to this file is updated using those buffers
 which have been modified or added in the specified versionedBufferFile 
 since olderVersion.  When complete, this file should be closed
 as soon as possible.

params.name: versionedBufferFile
params.comment: versioned buffer file

params.name: oldVersion
params.comment: older version of versionedBufferFile from which this buffer file originated.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

name: LocalManagedBufferFile
comment:
LocalManagedBufferFile implements a BufferFile as block-oriented
 random-access file which utilizes a BufferFileManager to 
 identify and facilitate versioning of buffer files.  This type of
 buffer file supports both save-as and save operations.  The file
 format used is identical to a LocalBufferFile, although additional
 support is provided for associated files which facilitate versioning
 (e.g., ChangeMapFile, VersionFile, and changed data files).

fields.javadoc: versionFileHandler provides original buffer file data for older non-updatable versions.
fields.name: versionFileHandler
fields.comment:
versionFileHandler provides original buffer file data for 
 older non-updatable versions.

fields.javadoc: versionOutFile tracks changes made to a pre-save file for reverse reconstruction.
fields.name: versionOutFile
fields.comment:
versionOutFile tracks changes made to a pre-save file for 
 reverse reconstruction.

fields.javadoc: changeMap tracks buffers which have been set.
fields.name: changeMap
fields.comment: changeMap tracks buffers which have been set.

fields.javadoc: version indicates the version of this buffer file. A value of 0 indicates that no version has been assigned.
fields.name: version
fields.comment:
version indicates the version of this buffer file.  A value
 of 0 indicates that no version has been assigned.

fields.javadoc: minChangeDataVer indicates the minimum change-data version which should be associated with this buffer file. A value of -1 indicates that no change-data is associated with this file. If set, the maximum change-data version always equals this buffer file's version minus one.
fields.name: minChangeDataVer
fields.comment:
minChangeDataVer indicates the minimum change-data version 
 which should be associated with this buffer file.  A value of -1 indicates
 that no change-data is associated with this file.  If set, the maximum 
 change-data version always equals this buffer file's version minus one.

fields.javadoc: nextChangeDataVer is utilized by the getNextChangeDataFile method in iterating through the various change-data files. @see #getNextChangeDataFile
fields.name: nextChangeDataVer
fields.comment:
nextChangeDataVer is utilized by the getNextChangeDataFile 
 method in iterating through the various change-data files.

fields.javadoc: comment stores the comment which will be passed to bfMgr when this new file version is stored. This applies to writable (!readOnly) files which have bfMgr set.
fields.name: comment
fields.comment:
comment stores the comment which will be passed to bfMgr when
 this new file version is stored.  This applies to writable (!readOnly) files
 which have bfMgr set.

fields.javadoc: bfMgr manages the various files associated with this buffer file. When working with versioned files or when Save support is required bfMgr must be set. The bufMgr will be null for a read-only non-updateable file.
fields.name: bfMgr
fields.comment:
bfMgr manages the various files associated with this buffer 
 file.  When working with versioned files or when Save support is 
 required bfMgr must be set.  The bufMgr will be null for
 a read-only non-updateable file.

fields.javadoc: checkinId is the checkin ID needed by bfMgr when a new version is created.
fields.name: checkinId
fields.comment:
checkinId is the checkin ID needed by bfMgr when a new
 version is created.

fields.javadoc: preSaveFile is a buffer file which contains a copy of this buffer file. The preSaveFile object is intantiated at the start of the pre-save task (see startPreSave()). If this object is not null and the preSaveThread is not running, the preSaveFile can be used as the basis of a Save operation. @see #startPreSave @see #getSaveFile
fields.name: preSaveFile
fields.comment:
preSaveFile is a buffer file which contains a copy of
 this buffer file.  The preSaveFile object is intantiated at
 the start of the pre-save task (see startPreSave()).  If this object is
 not null and the preSaveThread is not running, the preSaveFile
 can be used as the basis of a Save operation.

fields.javadoc: saveFile is the preSaveFile which is handed-out by the getSaveFile method. While not null, a Save is in-progress. The saveCompleted method must be invoked to terminate a Save operation on the saveFile. @see #getSaveFile @see #saveCompleted
fields.name: saveFile
fields.comment:
saveFile is the preSaveFile which is handed-out
 by the getSaveFile method.  While not null, a Save is in-progress.
 The saveCompleted method must be invoked to terminate a Save operation on
 the saveFile.

fields.javadoc: saveChangeFile is a buffer file which contains application specific change-data associated with a new version of this file. saveChangeFile is instantiated when the getSaveFile method is successfully invoked. This file is commited when the saveCompleted method is invoked.
fields.name: saveChangeFile
fields.comment:
saveChangeFile is a buffer file which contains application
 specific change-data associated with a new version of this file.
 saveChangeFile is instantiated when the getSaveFile method
 is successfully invoked.  This file is commited when the saveCompleted
 method is invoked.

fields.javadoc: preSaveFailed is set true when the pre-save is successfully terminated before completion.
fields.name: preSaveFailed
fields.comment:
preSaveFailed is set true when the pre-save is successfully
 terminated before completion.

fields.javadoc: preSaveBackoff is set true whenever an application read I/O operation is performed on this file. If the pre-save process is running, setting true will cause the pre-save to backoff for a short period.
fields.name: preSaveBackoff
fields.comment:
preSaveBackoff is set true whenever an application read I/O
 operation is performed on this file.  If the pre-save process is running,
 setting true will cause the pre-save to backoff for a short period.

fields.javadoc: preSaveLock is used to arbitrate access to the preSaveBackoff flag.
fields.name: preSaveLock
fields.comment: preSaveLock is used to arbitrate access to the preSaveBackoff flag.

fields.javadoc: preSaveThread corresponds to the PreSaveTask which creates the preSaveFile when this buffer file is updateable.
fields.name: preSaveTask
fields.comment:
preSaveThread corresponds to the PreSaveTask which creates the 
 preSaveFile when this buffer file is updateable.
